alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following county, Ripley. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM CDT, Emergency Management reported water beginning to pond on roadways due to heavy rain in Doniphan. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Doniphan is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area, and some of this heavy rain could be repeating over the same area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Doniphan, Naylor, Oxly, Budapest, Gatewood, Fairdealing, Handy and Briar.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
